alert.note: Alert for Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 19 at 9:43PM EST until January 21 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM SATURDAY TO 10 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. * WHERE...Southeast Nicholas, Southeast Webster, Northwest Pocahontas and Southeast Randolph Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 10 AM EST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 1 AM Saturday to 10 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Additional information can be found at https://www.weather.gov/rlx as well as on our Facebook and Twitter pages.

area.areaDesc: Northwest Pocahontas; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Randolph; Southeast Webster
